titles.ar: كتاب الزِّيِّ وَ التَّجَمُّلِ وَ الْمُرُوءَةِ
titles.en: The Book of Outfits and the Beautification and the Magnanimity

titles.ar: باب السُّنَّةِ فِي لُبْسِ الْخُفِّ وَ النَّعْلِ وَ خَلْعِهِمَا
titles.en: Chapter 20 – The Sunnah regarding wearing of the socks, and the sandals, and taking them off
Chapter 18 – The colour of the sandals

titles.ar: كتاب الزِّيِّ وَ التَّجَمُّلِ وَ الْمُرُوءَةِ
titles.en: The Book of Outfits and the Beautification and the Magnanimity

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (22/351)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ سَلَمَةَ بْنِ أَبِي حَبَّةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: لُبْسُ الْخُفِّ يَزِيدُ فِي قُوَّةِ الْبَصَرِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Muhammad Bin Isa, from Salma Bin Abu Habba,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Wearing the socks increases in the strength of the vision’.
en.sarwar: 1. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad from Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Salmah ibn abu Khadijah who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘If one wears al-Khuff (half-boot) his eyesight sharpens.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (22/351)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنِ الْعَوْسِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ الْمُسْلِيِّ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ بْنِ سَعْدٍ عَنْ مَنِيعٍ قَالَ

text: قَالَ أَبُو جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) لُبْسُ الْخُفِّ أَمَانٌ مِنَ السِّلِّ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Abu Abdullah, from Al Awsa, from Abu Ja’far Al Musliy, from Suleyman Bin Sa’ad, from Mani’a who said,
‘Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Wearing the socks is a security from the tuberculosis’.
en.sarwar: 2. A number of our people have narrated from Ahmad ibn abu ‘Abd Allah from al-‘Awsiy from abu Ja’far, al-Musliy from Sulayman ibn Sa‘d from Muni’ who has said the following: “Abu Ja‘far, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘Wearing al-Khuff (half-boot) provides immunity from tuberculoses.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/351)

narrator_chain.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ مُبَارَكٍ غُلَامِ الْعَقَرْقُوفِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِدْمَانُ لُبْسِ الْخُفِّ أَمَانٌ مِنَ السِّلِّ.

en.hubeali: From him, from one of our companions, from Mubarak a slave of Al Aqarquqy,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Habitual wearing of the socks is a security from the tuberculosis’.
en.sarwar: 3. It is narrated from the narrator of the previous Hadith from certain persons of our people from Mubarak Ghulam al-‘Aqarqufiy who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘Continuously wearing al-Khuff (half-boot) provides immunity against tuberculoses.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (22/351)

narrator_chain.text: عَنْهُ عَنْ بَعْضِ مَنْ ذَكَرَهُ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ دَاوُدَ الرَّقِّيِّ قَالَ

text: خَرَجْتُ مَعَ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) إِلَى يَنْبُعَ فَلَمَّا خَرَجَ رَأَيْتُ عَلَيْهِ خُفّاً أَحْمَرَ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ مَا هَذَا الْخُفُّ الْأَحْمَرُ الَّذِي أَرَاهُ عَلَيْكَ فَقَالَ خُفٌّ اتَّخَذْتُهُ لِلسَّفَرِ وَ هُوَ أَبْقَى عَلَى الطِّينِ وَ الْمَطَرِ وَ أَحْمَلُ لَهُ قُلْتُ فَأَتَّخِذُهَا وَ أَلْبَسُهَا قَالَ أَمَّا فِي السَّفَرِ فَنَعَمْ وَ أَمَّا فِي الْحَضَرِ فَلَا تَعْدِلَنَّ بِالسَّوَادِ شَيْئاً .

en.hubeali: From  him, form one whom mentioned it, from Muhammad Bin Sinan, from Dawood Al Raqqy who said,

‘I went out with Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> to Yanba’a. So when he<sup>asws</sup> came out, I saw red socks upon him<sup>asws</sup>, so I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘May I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>! What is this, the red socks which I see to be upon you<sup>asws</sup>?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Socks which I<sup>asws</sup> have taken for the journey, and it is more lasting upon the clay, and the rain, and more load-bearing for it’. I said, ‘So shall I<sup>asws</sup> take it and wear it?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘As for during the journey, so yes, and as for during the present, so do not change anything with the black’.
en.sarwar: 4. It is narrated from the narrator of the previous Hadith from Salim ibn Mukram from Muhammad ibn Sinan from Dawud al-Riqqiy who has said the following: “I once traveled with abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, to Yanbu‘. When he (the Imam) came out, I saw him wearing a red al-Khuff (half-boot). I then said, ‘I pray to Allah to keep my soul in service for your cause, what kind of shoe is this red shoe which I see you wearing?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘It is al- Khuff (half-boot) which I have found for traveling and it is good in clay (mud) and rain and more durable.’ I then asked, ‘Can I have such footgear?’ He (the Imam) said, ‘During a journey yes, you can have it, but not when you are at home; and do not exchange a black one for anything else.’” (Apparently it applies to al-Khuff (half-boot) only).

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/352)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ زِيَادِ بْنِ الْمُنْذِرِ قَالَ

text: دَخَلْتُ عَلَى أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) وَ عَلَيَّ خُفٌّ مَقْشُورٌ فَقَالَ يَا زِيَادُ مَا هَذَا الْخُفُّ الَّذِي أَرَاهُ عَلَيْكَ قُلْتُ خُفٌّ اتَّخَذْتُهُ فَقَالَ أَ مَا عَلِمْتَ أَنَّ الْبِيضَ مِنَ الْخِفَافِ يَعْنِي الْمَقْشُورَةَ مِنْ لِبَاسِ الْجَبَابِرَةِ وَ هُمْ أَوَّلُ مَنِ اتَّخَذَهَا وَ الْحُمْرَ مِنْ لِبَاسِ الْأَكَاسِرَةِ وَ هُمْ أَوَّلُ مَنِ اتَّخَذَهَا وَ السُّودَ مِنْ لِبَاسِ بَنِي هَاشِمٍ وَ سُنَّةٌ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Muhamamd Bin Sinan, from Ziyad Bin Al Munzar who said,

‘I went over to Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> and upon me were decorated socks, so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘O Ziyad! What are these socks which I<sup>asws</sup> see to be upon you?’ I said, ‘Socks which I have taken to’. So He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘But, do you know that the white is from the footwear, meaning the decorated ones, from the apparels of the tyrants, and they are the first ones to take to it; and the red is from the apparels of Caesars, and they are the first one to take to these; and the black are from the apparels of the Clan of Hashim<sup>as</sup>, and a Sunnah’.
en.sarwar: 5. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn ‘Isa from Muhammad ibn Sinan from Ziyad ibn al-Mundhir who has said the following: “I once visited abu Ja’far, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, and I was wearing al-Khuff (half-boot) which was Maqshurah. He (the Imam) said, ‘O, Ziyad, what is this which I see you wearing?’ I replied, ‘It is al- Khuff (half-boot) that I have found.’ He (the Imam) said, ‘Did you know that the white one of al-Khuff (half-boot) that is, al-Maqshurah is of the footgear of the tyrants and they were the ones who made it? The red ones are of the footgear of Kisra’s (Persian kings) and they were the first ones who made it. The black ones are of the footgear of banu Hashim and of the noble tradition.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (2/352)

narrator_chain.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ عَلِيٍّ الْبَغْدَادِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ الضَّرِيرِ عَنْ أَبِي سَلَمَةَ السَّرَّاجِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Muhammad Bin Abdullah, from Ali Al Baghdady, from Abu Al Hassan Al Zareyr, from Abu Salma Al Sarraj,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Habitually wearing the sock prevents the evil death’.
en.sarwar: 6. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad from Muhammad ibn ‘Abd Allah from Ali al-Baghdadiy from abu al- Hassan al-Darir from abu Salmah al-Sarraj who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘Continuously wearing al-Khuff (half-boot) is protection against dying badly.’”
